snippet.textDisplay:
Oh it aches! Starting late as I just slept the first 10 days instead of joining Adriene against my best judgement. I’ve never struggled sitting in cross legged pose, but with a knee injury and tight hips today I feel old and in pain. Only 44 but feeling 84 today.

I can’t even get comfy in this sitting pose. My knees are up and it’s exhausting! I’ve let myself go so badly these last two years and I’m praying I can recover my flexibility and not ache all day and night long.

Definitely discovered lower back pain and tightness in my hips.

Thank you so much for this practise Adriene. I’ve started. This is happening. Namaste x
snippet.textOriginal:
Oh it aches! Starting late as I just slept the first 10 days instead of joining Adriene against my best judgement. I’ve never struggled sitting in cross legged pose, but with a knee injury and tight hips today I feel old and in pain. Only 44 but feeling 84 today.  

I can’t even get comfy in this sitting pose. My knees are up and it’s exhausting! I’ve let myself go so badly these last two years and I’m praying I can recover my flexibility and not ache all day and night long. 

Definitely discovered lower back pain and tightness in my hips. 

Thank you so much for this practise Adriene. I’ve started. This is happening. Namaste x

snippet.textDisplay: Trying to get back into yoga after a stressful year I barely had time to do much beyond function and, I've got to say, despite the muscle tightness that I had expected to happen, I'm so glad I can still find my flexibility and strength I had built up previously. I really look forward to following your series, Adriene, despite having starting late! Lots of love to you, and to everyone, I look forward to this journey!

snippet.textDisplay: OMG! I SHOWED UP! I just started. Today was my day1and I actually finished the whole session. Although I had to rewind a few times. This showed me how tight I am in my back, neck and hamstrings. It was so hard for me to do some of the bending over and using my hands to hold my upper body up, I realized how weak my wrists are too.   I made a commitment to start this 30-days of yoga with Adriene and I will do my best to keep Showing Up! See ya on day 2!
snippet.textOriginal: OMG! I SHOWED UP! I just started. Today was my day1and I actually finished the whole session. Although I had to rewind a few times. This showed me how tight I am in my back, neck and hamstrings. It was so hard for me to do some of the bending over and using my hands to hold my upper body up, I realized how weak my wrists are too.   I made a commitment to start this 30-days of yoga with Adriene and I will do my best to keep Showing Up! See ya on day 2!

snippet.textDisplay: Adriene, thank you for your gifts in the world. I have an important question about preparation for yoga practice. How much exercise does Benji (the cattle dog?) get before he joins you for yoga? My Border collie mix needs a fair bit--more fast-pasted vinyasa style!--before he can emulate Benji's moves and share the mat.

I've just discovered this amazing channel and decided to enjoy immediately this incredible 30Day journey. After 15 years I'm trying to stop smoking (10 days already without it), so hopefully, this experience and yoga in general will help me with my challenge.
Thank you, Adrienne.
Best regards from Italy. <3

snippet.textDisplay: I just wanted to say. I did your Yoga videos for about two years now. I recently joined a hot yoga gym where they have a 1 hour and 30 minute class!! It is intense and AMAZING and I have learned so much. I remember when 20 minutes of Yoga felt like forever. Now it feels short. Thanks for being a part of my story and starting my love for yoga!! I still do your videos on days I dont feel like going to the gym (or can't because snow). Ive come a long way!!
snippet.textOriginal: I just wanted to say. I did your Yoga videos for about two years now. I recently joined a hot yoga gym where they have a 1 hour and 30 minute class!! It is intense and AMAZING and I have learned so much. I remember when 20 minutes of Yoga felt like forever. Now it feels short. Thanks for being a part of my story and starting my love for yoga!! I still do your videos on days I dont feel like going to the gym (or can't because snow). Ive come a long way!!

snippet.textDisplay:
I have been struggling with CPTSD due to childhood sexual abuse for a year now. My body is always taught and tense, and everything hurts, as I am hypervigilant and feel broken.

I started to cry uncontrollably several times, but Adriene's voice is always so loving and calm that it brings me back into the now and a space of inner freedom. Now I feel much less tense than before, and.... happy? Is that the right word?

Thank you so much, Adriene, for your help. ❤
snippet.textOriginal:
I have been struggling with CPTSD due to childhood sexual abuse for a year now. My body is always taught and tense, and everything hurts, as I am hypervigilant and feel broken. 

I started to cry uncontrollably several times, but Adriene's voice is always so loving and calm that it brings me back into the now and a space of inner freedom. Now I feel much less tense than before, and.... happy? Is that the right word?

Thank you so much, Adriene, for your help. ❤

snippet.textDisplay: Day 1🤗
snippet.textOriginal: Day 1🤗

snippet.textDisplay:
Dear Adriene! 

With your challenge 5 years ago started really important changes in my life - my whole world is totally different now.

And I've recalled the moments spent with the videos you've made as the really sweet moments.
I've really wanted to repeat it.

And how happy I am now with the new challenge you've started! You truly are my personal fairy!!
snippet.textOriginal:
Dear Adriene! 

With your challenge 5 years ago started really important changes in my life - my whole world is totally different now.

And I've recalled the moments spent with the videos you've made as the really sweet moments.
I've really wanted to repeat it.

And how happy I am now with the new challenge you've started! You truly are my personal fairy!!

snippet.textDisplay:
Today is my day 1 and I can't believe how relax I am right now. I didn't even notice how tense I was from my day at work. Those 43 min allows me to totally deconnect from the world and only focus on myself. Thank you for this, Adrienne.


Starting Yoga was my new resolution this year and I went by your channel just by putting "yoga" in the research keybord. You were the first one to pop up and I'm so glad. I look forward to those next 30 days, and the following journey that is beginning.
snippet.textOriginal:
Today is my day 1 and I can't believe how relax I am right now. I didn't even notice how tense I was from my day at work. Those 43 min allows me to totally deconnect from the world and only focus on myself. Thank you for this, Adrienne.

snippet.textDisplay: Day 1 in the books! snippet.textDisplay:
This is my third year doing Adriene's 30 day yoga challenge in January and the first year I'm very late too it, oops! I've been busy applying for master programs and haven't been showing myself much self-love. Decided it doesn't matter where I start, I just need to do it!

I mostly came here to share however that my new puppy, who experienced me doing my first full flow, laid so many toys and bones around me as I was doing this practice. And while laying down at the end, she even placed them on me. I couldn't stop laughing! She brought so much happiness to this practice. Truly little angels <3
snippet.textOriginal:
This is my third year doing Adriene's 30 day yoga challenge in January and the first year I'm very late too it, oops! I've been busy applying for master programs and haven't been showing myself much self-love. Decided it doesn't matter where I start, I just need to do it! 

I mostly came here to share however that my new puppy, who experienced me doing my first full flow, laid so many toys and bones around me as I was doing this practice. And while laying down at the end, she even placed them on me. I couldn't stop laughing! She brought so much happiness to this practice. Truly little angels <3

snippet.textDisplay: Bit late to the game, but once I was on the mat, I knew I had to see it through. A lot has changed since the last time i did 30 Days of Yoga, and it showed. I had to drop to my knees during that first downward dog. I also didn't realize how incredibly tense my shoulders were. I decided that's what my main goal is going to be to loosen them up after working a desk job. I can't wait for the next day. Namaste! 🙏
snippet.textOriginal: Bit late to the game, but once I was on the mat, I knew I had to see it through. A lot has changed since the last time i did 30 Days of Yoga, and it showed. snippet.textDisplay: Whoa, I actually did this! I felt so tired and old. I struggle with a few disorders, but I recognized how much I've been carrying on my shoulders and I recognized that there's still me underneath all this load and that I'm not defined by it. Thank you Adriene, you do wonders. ❤

snippet.textDisplay: this was so amazing and relaxing. thank you!
snippet.textOriginal: this was so amazing and relaxing. thank you!

snippet.textDisplay: I have been following you for years and I can't explain how much you mean to me. It started off 2013 after I had been in a riding accident and broke my back, I used your videos to help me recover for a year. I fell in love with yoga because of you, and honestly I've been to so many yoga practices but yours are, still, my absolute favourite. When I'm travelling all over the world and whenever I feel sad or alone, I know I can come back to my matt, play your videos and feel safe and home. You are amazing and fantastic, I love everything about your practice and I'm so grateful for you.
snippet.textOriginal: I have been following you for years and I can't explain how much you mean to me. snippet.textDisplay: Hello Adriene! Thank you so much for everything that you do. I am a newbie and I am feeling it all out so far. My anger issues and depression has brought me to you and I am so thankful. I am just getting started; I do not own a mat, or blocks, or even special yoga clothes but I have done a few of your videos and already feel a big difference in myself. Although, this is sort of personal but this morning I was doing this video and there was so much commotion going on in my house and I kept getting interrupted during my practice with this video and it was SO frustrating, I got very angry and I almost just turned it off but I did actually make it to the end. This would not be the first time that this has happened and I am sure it won't be the last. Do you have any advice for me? If you reply, I appreciate it, if not I understand. THANK YOU!
snippet.textOriginal: Hello Adriene! Thank you so much for everything that you do. I am a newbie and I am feeling it all out so far. My anger issues and depression has brought me to you and I am so thankful. I am just getting started; I do not own a mat, or blocks, or even special yoga clothes but I have done a few of your videos and already feel a big difference in myself. Although, this is sort of personal but this morning I was doing this video and there was so much commotion going on in my house and I kept getting interrupted during my practice with this video and it was SO frustrating, I got very angry and I almost just turned it off but I did actually make it to the end. This would not be the first time that this has happened and I am sure it won't be the last. Do you have any advice for me? If you reply, I appreciate it, if not I understand. THANK YOU!

I coud not all the exercisesrs and I fist I thought that I had to do it all over again. But if I did that I would loose my spirit And some of us have the same problemes I had new discoveries where my paines where. Maybe hidden paines from way back.And I was really admitting to my self all these paines. I knew was there. And Very important was that.I have a pain in my stormach systom. wiich. I need a doctor to look into. I can relate this stomach pain with another issue that I am struggeling with. I felt a feeling of crying, that really suuppriesed me and I can’n recognise anything

Thank you ever so much.

snippet.textDisplay: Life has been difficult too many times the past few years and I needed to make some changes. I have tried yoga a few times and my friend raves about you so I have decided to give this a try. I am 54 and have had a slightly smaller than normal lung capacity from birth. I made it through 19 minutes today but by then I felt nauseous and dizzy mostly from trying to take deep breaths. Inhaling is the hardest. I will come back to it, but do you have tips to help me?
snippet.textOriginal: Life has been difficult too many times the past few years and I needed to make some changes. I have tried yoga a few times and my friend raves about you so I have decided to give this a try. I am 54 and have had a slightly smaller than normal lung capacity from birth. I made it through 19 minutes today but by then I felt nauseous and dizzy mostly from trying to take deep breaths. Inhaling is the hardest. I will come back to it, but do you have tips to help me?

snippet.textDisplay: Girlfriend you have inspired me for years now. Every year for my bday I ask my hubby for my Adriene, subscription. My nickname is Adriene, you also are a verb in our family. "Mom are you Adrieneing? I now have received my 200 hours of Yoga training, so thank you for that. You make me laugh and feel like I am hanging out with my sister or good friend. Great job on the Today show. You are going to crush it even more. Your Gratitude and Abundant attitude has spread world wide! xoxox Much Gratitude and Love, Noelle please come to Sun Valley, Idaho. I have a studio and this community would love you.....noellewillettsv@gmail.com Great yogis practice and visit here. Come Join. I will host you. Happy New Year 2020 Game On!

snippet.textDisplay: You're the best!!!
snippet.textOriginal: You're the best!!!

snippet.textDisplay:
Day 1 starting today after finishing yoga camp!!! So day 31 I’m so excited!!

Thank you a million times for following your purpose and sharing that with us 💙💙

After video edit: giggles with “don’t need to get so high on first day” lol... I so wanted acknowledge that doing the 30 day of yoga camp , allowed me to release my attachment of needing to be high all the time. Thank you for helping me release that addiction. No judgements for anyone who does it !!! I just need to learn how to love me without it for some time.

And doing day 1 again is soooooo essential I can see! It reminded me of how important alignment is. It’s going to only further my yoga practice
snippet.textOriginal:
Day 1 starting today after finishing yoga camp!!! So day 31 I’m so excited!! 

Thank you a million times for following your purpose and sharing that with us 💙💙 

After video edit: *giggles* with “don’t need to get so high on first day”  lol... I so wanted acknowledge that doing the 30 day of yoga camp , allowed me to release my attachment of needing to be high all the time. Thank you for helping me release that addiction. No judgements for anyone who does it !!! I just need to learn how to love me without it for some time. 

And doing day 1 again is soooooo essential I can see! It reminded me of how important alignment is. It’s going to only further my yoga practice

snippet.textDisplay: Im a little late beginning this year. My community is suffering, so many homes lost and fires still raging.  My family & home is safe. But no-one is 'OK'.  We are feeling lost and helpless. HOME means so much.  So its time to build strength & resilience through love & community. Our local yoga class hugged & cried last night at our first practice together in weeks.  I havent practiced asana at home for weeks I said, my teacher (and friend) reminded me that we have still been practicing yoga.  So I made it to the mat this morning and feel ready to face the day with more hugs, and helping our community however I can to re-build our home together. Thank you for your offering Adrienne. With Love and Gratitude.
snippet.textOriginal: Im a little late beginning this year. My community is suffering, so many homes lost and fires still raging.  My family & home is safe. But no-one is 'OK'.  We are feeling lost and helpless. HOME means so much.  So its time to build strength & resilience through love & community. Our local yoga class hugged & cried last night at our first practice together in weeks.  I havent practiced asana at home for weeks I said, my teacher (and friend) reminded me that we have still been practicing yoga.  So I made it to the mat this morning and feel ready to face the day with more hugs, and helping our community however I can to re-build our home together. Thank you for your offering Adrienne. With Love and Gratitude.

Namaste :)

snippet.textDisplay: My! Aren't there a lot of people on this! I looked at the huge list of comments. It's wonderful,I enjoy this so much. I am a few days late, and you  know what? I did 20 minutes. no pressure with walking dogs, doing Qigong, Win hot breathing, doing light therapy, doing sauna, everyday, except the sauna which is every other day. Looking forward to do the further 24 minutes hopefully tomorrow. Thank you so much!

snippet.textDisplay: My pup, Luna, napped close by today during my day 1 practice. Love having our dogs as part of the journey. AND, whenever I"m reminded to relax my forehead or my face, I always smile :)Thank you, Adriene. I already love your real, down to earth nature and I'm excited for the next month with you.

snippet.textOriginal: I wish you would have said pet your pet sooner. I smacked mine.

snippet.textDisplay: I'm glad we're starting slow - I just had back injections a few days ago and I have to take it easy (which is KILLING me) and I tend to overdo things. I just finished Dedicate before the injections and was doing an hour of yoga videos a day and getting pretty strong. I had to stop lifting weights for a while and mentally it's been really hard, but doing your videos has made it so much easier and I feel so good! I'm glad I was able to do this gentle practice today and looking forward to easing in to help my back recover :)

snippet.textDisplay: My search for a practice to support me in the later stages of my recovery from head injury ended here. After (very slowly, listening to my body) completion of this I feel a peace I've struggled to find within myself for years! The cat joined in too, we both look forward to completing day 2 tomorrow!

snippet.textDisplay:
Oooh! Adriene, I'm so grateful to have you. So so so grateful. (English is not my first language. Excuse my mistakes please).
You don't even know how much you helped me going through a very bad PTSD (sexually abused and all the mental and physical consequences) of this. Then, receiving a diagnostic for a degenerative disease at only 42 years old.... Adriene, please take all my gratitude and continue to enlighten our days. You are an amazing person with an amazing heart. If I feel better today, it's partly because of you.
One breath at the time, right?
Thank you, so much ❤️❤️
